text:
snoop.jsp under tomcat example has security vulnerability.A remote attacker 
could use this script to view internal IP addresses and other sensitive 
information. Shipping it by default raises security loop holes regarding the 
server.
creator: shantalabhat@hotmail.com

text:
And How about its vulnerability when we access the same jsp with following url.
http://localhost:8080/jsp-examples/snp/snoop.jsp/`<script>alert('Vulnerable')
</script>
Here there are chances of Vunerable code getting executed at server side.
creator: shantalabhat@hotmail.com

text: This has been raised previously and has been fixed.
creator: markt@apache.org
shantalabhat@hotmail.com
text:
I am not able to find this bug reported previously.
If it is fixed can you please tell me the exact version of tomcat from which 
the fix is applied. This would help me in upgrading my tomcat to that 
particular version.If you can send the bug number which has reported the same 
previously will surely help.

I am finding the same behaviour in recent version of tomcat 5.5.16. i e " 
remote attacker 
could use this script to view internal IP addresses and other sensitive 
information. Shipping it by default raises security loop holes regarding the 
server." 

Please let me know what is the fix for the same.
creator: shantalabhat@hotmail.com

text:
I feel taking out snoop.jsp from the jsp-example archive will surely fix this 
security loop. Providing the same by default can lead to the security 
vulnerability.
creator: shantalabhat@hotmail.com
